normalized: --the blood did not stop.
she had avoided being fatally wounded, but oboro's wounds were severe.
her blood trickled down the underground stairway.

name: oboro's clone
normalized: asagi--
she was making a beeline towards the deepest parts of the building, trembling her body in anger as she did so.
she wanted more than nothing else to have instant retribution over that woman, but now, escape had to be her first priority.
she had come here, to a large tunnel that had been abandoned in the middle of development.
the air was stagnant and faintly musty.
the subway should have connected the island with honshu, but the project had been suspended midway--
now, it was only the tracks running under tokyo bay that remained.
while dragging her heavy body that continued to bleed, oboro's clone hurried to escape.
she staggered a bit and slouched down.

name: oboro's clone
normalized: kuu…
she had lost way too much blood.
she found it pathetic, but she flat-out couldn't stand back up.
suddenly, she felt she heard asagi's roar.
she looked around herself in a panic.
but, there was no one--
knowing what it felt like to be almost freakishly frightened filled her with indignation.

name: oboro's clone
normalized: good grief, how did she do that…, that sort of…
she ought to have thoroughly studied what ninja blood was capable of.
she understood perfectly the possibility of transfiguring.
but, being able to mutate by self-determination was something she had never heard from her lab staff.

name: oboro's clone
normalized: no way…, could it be she's awoken a self-made ninja gene?
no doubt.
i had a little help in that

name: oboro's clone
normalized: who are you!?

she hadn't expected anyone to be there, but there stood a man clad in a ninja uniform.
you're a sorry thing.
i needed you to keep at it a little longer

name: oboro's clone
normalized: you are--, asagi's partner!?

name: oboro's clone
normalized: …you're not asagi's partner?
